evidence.text: No appeal filed or referenced in any document through June 23, 2025, including all docket entries, motions, orders, and opinions.
19 | 2025-06-06 | ORDER by Judge Rita F. Lin granting 5 Motion for Pro Hac Vice as to Erwin Chemerinsky. (mkl, COURT STAFF) (Filed on 6/6/2025) (Entered: 06/06/2025)

extracted.value: The court granted the Motion for Pro Hac Vice on June 6, 2025, allowing Erwin Chemerinsky to appear in the case pro hac vice.

evidence.text: 20 | 2025-06-06 | ORDER SETTING STATUS CONFERENCE. Signed by Judge Rita F. Lin on 6/6/2025. Status Conference set for 6/9/2025 11:00 AM in San Francisco - Videoconference Only before Judge Rita F. Lin. This proceeding will be held via a Zoom webinar.Webinar Access: All counsel, members of the public, and media may access the webinar information at https://www.cand.uscourts.gov/judges/lin-rita-f-rfl/General Order 58. Persons granted access to court proceedings held by telephone or videoconference are reminded that photographing, recording, and rebroadcasting of court proceedings, including screenshots or other visual copying of a hearing, is absolutely prohibited.Zoom Guidance and Setup: https://www.cand.uscourts.gov/zoom/.(mkl, COURT STAFF) (Filed on 6/6/2025) (Entered: 06/06/2025)

extracted.value: The court set a Status Conference for June 9, 2025, and ordered the parties to meet and confer on early discovery.

evidence.text: 28 | 2025-06-09 | Minute Entry for proceedings held by Zoom before Judge Rita F. Lin: Status Conference held on 6/9/2025. The Court grants the 25 Stipulation for Briefing Schedule and Hearing on Plaintiffs' Motions (Dkt. Nos. 7 and 18 ) and 16 Administrative Motion to Exceed Page Limits. Plaintiffs' request for 50 pages for the Motion for TRO is granted. Opposition (50 page limit) due by 6/12/2025. Reply (30 page limit) due by 6/17/2025. Motion Hearing set for 6/20/2025 10:00 AM in San Francisco, Courtroom 15, 18th Floor before Judge Rita F. Lin. Parties to meet and confer on the scope of early discovery and file a stipulation/proposed order or a joint statement with their respective proposals by 6/11/2025. Total Time in Court: 22 minutes. Court Reporter: Ruth Levine Ekhaus. Attorneys for Plaintiffs: Elizabeth Cabraser, Richard Heimann, Kevin Budner, Tony Schoenberg, and Claudia Polsky. Attorney for Defendants: Jason Altabet. (This is a text-only entry generated by the court. There is no document associated with this entry.) (mkl, COURT STAFF) (Date Filed: 6/9/2025) (Entered: 06/09/2025)

extracted.value: The court granted the Stipulation setting a briefing schedule for the motions on June 9, 2025, with opposition due June 12 and reply due June 17.

evidence.text: 45 | 2025-06-19 | ORDER. The file submitted as Dkt. No. 43-1 appears to be incomplete. Defendants are ORDERED to re-file a corrected version of the document. Signed by Judge Rita F. Lin on June 19, 2025. (This is a text-only entry generated by the court. There is no document associated with this entry.) (rfllc3, COURT STAFF) (Filed on 6/19/2025) (Entered: 06/19/2025)

extracted.value: The court ordered Defendants to re-file a corrected version of the Supplemental Brief on June 19, 2025, due to an incomplete document.

evidence.text: 54 | 2025-06-23 | ORDER  by Judge Rita F. Lin granting  7  Motion for Preliminary Injunction, as modified and granting  18  Motion to Certify Class.(rfllc3, COURT STAFF) (Filed on 6/23/2025)

extracted.value: The court granted the Motion for Preliminary Injunction and the Motion to Certify Class on June 23, 2025, as modified.

evidence.text: 55 | 2025-06-23 | Preliminary Injunction Order. Signed by Judge Rita F. Lin on June 23, 2025. (rfllc3, COURT STAFF) (Filed on 6/23/2025) (Entered: 06/23/2025)

extracted.value: The court issued a Preliminary Injunction Order on June 23, 2025, enjoining defendants from certain actions.

evidence.text: 56 | 2025-06-23 | CASE MANAGEMENT SCHEDULING ORDER: Initial Case Management Conference set for 7/2/2025 11:00 AM in San Francisco, via Videoconference Only. Case Management Statement ("CMS") due by 6/30/2025. The CMS should include a status report from Defendants confirming that all steps to comply with the preliminary injunction have been completed or, in the event that has not occurred, an explanation of why it was not feasible and a description of the steps that have been taken thus far. Signed by Judge Rita F. Lin on June 23, 2025. (This is a text-only entry generated by the court. There is no document associated with this entry.) (rfllc3, COURT STAFF) (Filed on 6/23/2025) (Entered: 06/23/2025)

extracted.value: The court issued a Case Management Scheduling Order on June 23, 2025, setting a new Case Management Conference and requiring a status report on compliance with the injunction.

evidence.text: 1 | 2025-06-04 | COMPLAINT against AmeriCorps (a.k.a the Corporation for National and Community Service), Jennifer Bastress Tahmasebi, Jayanta Bhattacharya, Doug Burgum, Matthew Buzzelli, Department Of Government Efficiency ("DOGE"), Department of Transportation, Sean Duffy, Amy Gleason, Pete Hegseth, Institute of Museum and Library Services, Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., Martin A. Makary, Michael McDonald, Linda McMahon, National Endowment for the Humanities, National Science Foundation, Brooke Rollins, Marco Rubio, Keith Sonderling, Brian Stone, Donald J. Trump, United States Centers for Disease Control, United States Department of Agriculture, United States Department of Defense, United States Department of Education, United States Department of Energy, United States Department of Health and Human Services, United States Department of State, United States Department of the Interior, United States Environmental Protection Agency, United States Food and Drug Administration, United States National Institutes of Health, Chris Wright, Lee Zeldin ( Filing fee $ 405, receipt number ACANDC-20754681.). Injunction against the US government/official or APA vacatur requested. Filed by Ken Alex, Neeta Thakur, Jedda Foreman, Nell Green Nylen, Robert Hirst, Christine Philliou. (Cabraser, Elizabeth) (Filed on 6/4/2025) (Entered: 06/04/2025)

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Complaint on June 4, 2025, requesting an injunction against the U.S. government and officials under the APA, alleging violations of constitutional and statutory rights.
